content:
DataSourceExpression Class

In this Article

Represents a base class for creating expression classes.

Syntax

Declaration

public abstract class DataSourceExpression : System.Web.UI.IStateManager

Inheritance Hierarchy

  • System.Object
  • DataSourceExpression

Inherited Members

Equals(Object)
,
Equals(Object,Object)
,
GetHashCode()
,
GetType()
,
MemberwiseClone()
,
ReferenceEquals(Object,Object)
,
ToString()

Constructors summary

DataSourceExpression()

Initializes a new instance of the DataSourceExpression class.

Properties summary

Context

Gets the HttpContext instance of the owner control.
DataSource

Gets the data source object that is associated with the owner control.
IsTrackingViewState

Gets a value that indicates whether a data source expression object is tracking its view state changes.
Owner

Gets the owner control.
ViewState

Gets an instance of the StateBag class that contains the current view state information.

Methods summary

GetQueryable(IQueryable)

Evaluates the DataSourceExpression instance using the IQueryable interface.
LoadViewState(Object)

Loads the state of the values in the DataSourceExpression object that must be persisted.
SaveViewState()

Saves the current view state of the DataSourceExpression object.
SetContext(Control,HttpContext,IQueryableDataSource)

Sets the HTTP context of the DataSourceExpression object that uses the specified owner control, HttpContext instance, and IQueryableDataSource object.
SetDirty()

Marks the DataSourceExpression object so that its state will be saved in view state.
TrackViewState()

Tracks view state changes of the DataSourceExpression object so that the changes can be stored in the StateBag object for the data source expression object.

Explicit Interface Implementations summary

IStateManager.IsTrackingViewState

When implemented by a class, gets a value that indicates whether a data source expression object is tracking its view state changes.
IStateManager.LoadViewState(Object)

When implemented by a class, loads the previously saved view state of the data source expression object.
IStateManager.SaveViewState()

When implemented by a class, saves the current view state of the DataSourceExpression object.
IStateManager.TrackViewState()

When implemented by a class, tracks view state changes of the DataSourceExpression object so that the changes can be stored in the StateBag object for the data source expression object.

Constructors

  • DataSourceExpression()

    Initializes a new instance of the DataSourceExpression class.

    protected DataSourceExpression ();

Properties

  • Context

    Gets the HttpContext instance of the owner control.

    protected System.Web.HttpContext Context { get; }

    Property Value

    • HttpContext

      The HTTP context instance of the owner control.

  • DataSource

    Gets the data source object that is associated with the owner control.

    public System.Web.UI.WebControls.IQueryableDataSource DataSource { get; }

    Property Value

    • IQueryableDataSource

      The data source object that is associated with the owner control.

  • IsTrackingViewState

    Gets a value that indicates whether a data source expression object is tracking its view state changes.

    protected bool IsTrackingViewState { get; }

    Property Value

    • Boolean

      true if the data source expression object is tracking its view state changes; otherwise, false.

  • Owner

    Gets the owner control.

    protected System.Web.UI.Control Owner { get; }

    Property Value

    • Control

      The owner control.

  • ViewState

    Gets an instance of the StateBag class that contains the current view state information.

    protected System.Web.UI.StateBag ViewState { get; }

    Property Value

    • StateBag

      An instance of the state bag object that contains the current view state information.

Methods

  • GetQueryable(IQueryable)

    Evaluates the DataSourceExpression instance using the IQueryable interface.

    public abstract System.Linq.IQueryable GetQueryable (System.Linq.IQueryable source);

    Parameters

    • source
      IQueryable

      The IQueryable object that the expression is added to.

    Returns

    • IQueryable

      An instance of IQueryable object that was used to evaluate the data source expression.

  • LoadViewState(Object)

    Loads the state of the values in the DataSourceExpression object that must be persisted.

    protected virtual void LoadViewState (object savedState);

    Parameters

    • savedState
      System.Object

      An object that represents the state of the DataSourceExpression object.

  • SaveViewState()

    Saves the current view state of the DataSourceExpression object.

    protected virtual object SaveViewState ();

    Returns

    • System.Object

      An object that contains the saved state of the data source expression.

  • SetContext(Control,HttpContext,IQueryableDataSource)

    Sets the HTTP context of the DataSourceExpression object that uses the specified owner control, HttpContext instance, and IQueryableDataSource object.

    public virtual void SetContext (System.Web.UI.Control owner, System.Web.HttpContext context, System.Web.UI.WebControls.IQueryableDataSource dataSource);

    Parameters

    • owner
      Control

      The owner control of the IQueryable data source object.

    • context
      HttpContext

      The data context to use.

    • dataSource
      IQueryableDataSource

      The IQueryable data source object to use.

  • SetDirty()

    Marks the DataSourceExpression object so that its state will be saved in view state.

    public void SetDirty ();
  • TrackViewState()

    Tracks view state changes of the DataSourceExpression object so that the changes can be stored in the StateBag object for the data source expression object.

    protected virtual void TrackViewState ();

Explicit Interface Implementations

  • IStateManager.IsTrackingViewState

    When implemented by a class, gets a value that indicates whether a data source expression object is tracking its view state changes.

    bool System.Web.UI.IStateManager.IsTrackingViewState { get; }

    Returns

    • Boolean

      true if a data source expression object is tracking its view state changes; otherwise, false.

    Remarks

    This member is an explicit interface member implementation. It can be used only when the DataSourceExpression instance is cast to an IStateManager interface.

  • IStateManager.LoadViewState(Object)

    When implemented by a class, loads the previously saved view state of the data source expression object.

    void IStateManager.LoadViewState (object state);

    Parameters

    • state
      System.Object

      The object that represents the saved view state values for the data source expression object.

    Remarks

    This member is an explicit interface member implementation. It can be used only when the DataSourceExpression instance is cast to an IStateManager interface.

  • IStateManager.SaveViewState()

    When implemented by a class, saves the current view state of the DataSourceExpression object.

    object IStateManager.SaveViewState ();

    Returns

    • System.Object

      The object that contains the view state changes.

    Remarks

    This member is an explicit interface member implementation. It can be used only when the DataSourceExpression instance is cast to an IStateManager interface.

  • IStateManager.TrackViewState()

    When implemented by a class, tracks view state changes of the DataSourceExpression object so that the changes can be stored in the StateBag object for the data source expression object.

    void IStateManager.TrackViewState ();

    Remarks

    This member is an explicit interface member implementation. It can be used only when the DataSourceExpression instance is cast to an IStateManager interface.
